metadata.title: RHSA-2020:2592: OpenShift Container Platform 4.2.36 containernetworking-plugins security update (Moderate)
metadata.description:
The Container Network Interface (CNI) project consists of a specification and libraries for writing plug-ins for configuring network interfaces in Linux containers, along with a number of supported plug-ins. CNI concerns itself only with network connectivity of containers and removing allocated resources when the container is deleted. 

Security Fix(es):

* containernetworking/plugins: IPv6 router advertisements allowed for MitM attacks on IPv4 clusters (CVE-2020-10749)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

bugzilla.text: IPv6 router advertisements allow for MitM attacks on IPv4 clusters

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
containernetworking-plugins is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
